description: Your ability to work effectively with PMs, developers, and stakeholders through clear communication and collaboration.

scoreMeaning.strong: You build strong partnerships with PMs and devs. You communicate design rationale clearly and collaborate effectively throughout the product process.
scoreMeaning.decent: You can work with cross-functional partners, but may struggle with communication, handoffs, or building strategic partnerships.
scoreMeaning.needsImprovement: You work mostly in isolation or struggle with collaboration. Handoffs are unclear, or you have difficulty explaining design decisions.

strong: Set up recurring design-PM 1:1s focused on roadmap and strategy, not just tickets.
Standardize handoff process with clear documentation (states, specs, edge cases).
Involve devs early in design process through design reviews or pairing.
Create design system documentation that helps devs implement consistently.
decent: Share early sketches with PMs instead of polished flows.
Add a short design walkthrough before each major implementation starts.
Standardize handoff with a simple checklist (states, specs, edge cases).
Practice presenting a design in 2-3 minutes focusing on user and outcome.
needsImprovement: Schedule a design walkthrough with devs before implementation starts.
Create a simple handoff checklist and use it for every feature.
Practice explaining your design decisions in plain language.
Read about design-dev collaboration and PM-designer partnerships.

examplesOfStrong: You build strong partnerships with PMs and devs that improve product outcomes.
Design handoffs are smooth with clear documentation and communication.
You influence product decisions through effective communication and collaboration.
examplesOfWeak: Handoffs are unclear, leading to implementation issues or rework.
You struggle to explain design decisions to non-designers.
You work in isolation without building cross-functional partnerships.
